data.title: Everyone but Fajza — John P. Portelli
data.meta_description: A sneak peak at John’s newest book
data.text:
A sneak peak at John’s newest book, Everyone But Fajza.

Chapter 1

January 17: Station CP 24

Word has just reached us that a young woman has been assaulted and wounded twice by gunshot to her shoulder. The assault took place at around 7 p.m. in the vicinity of Kipling and Birmingham. A police search is under way. More information as the case unfolds.

January 17: CBC Radio Live FM 98

Welcome to the 9p.m. news.

A young woman with gunshot wounds to the chest has disappeared in the vicinity of the high school on Birmingham Street. According to police sources, the only evidence collected on the scene was blood stains on the street and a purple handkerchief with a yellow floral motif. A number of violent incidents have been reported at this school in recent months. Police are currently searching the building., which normally remains openin in the evenings for adult courses.

We shall keep following the case and report back to you as the investigation progresses.

January 18: Toronto Star

Yesterday evening, twenty-year-old Fajza Renzi, wife of Italian-born contractor Sergio Renzi, was shot in the leg and left to die on Birmingham Street next to what is considered one of Etobicoke’s most violent schools, in the industrial area. In the past months, police reported several incidences around the school involving drug-dealing gangs. There is no evidence as to who committed the crime and the motive behind it.

It appears that the young woman was dropped in front of St. Joseph’s Health Centre by a young man. As of this morning she has still not regained consciousness and her state is said to be critical. Besides the leg injury, she is also suffering from severe shock.

An appeal for blood donations of the O negative type is being made.

January 18: Toronto Sun

Fajza Renzi, wife of well-known contractor Sergio Renzi, has sustained a serious thigh injury caused by gunshot. She was found in an area notorious for drug trafficking and soliciting. It is possible that Mrs. Renzi was assaulted. Police are investigating.

Reliable sources, however , have informed us that the assault could be the result of a settling of scores related to Mr. Renzi’s past illicit dealings. Women who worked in Mr. Renzi’s clubs have spoken of ill-treatment. Moreover, it appears that an ex-lover of Mrs. Renzi - allegedly the son of renowned businessman Stephen Abdilla - recently made contact with her again.

In hospital with the victim ar her parents, siblings and aunt. Rumors have it that they parents are on bad terms due to disagreement about their daughter’s marriage to Mr. Renzi, .

January 18: Italian News

Prominent businessman Sergio Renzi hits the headlines again. This time it is in relation to the wounding of his young wife yesterday evening in the vicinity of Kipling Street and Lakeshore Boulevard. It is yet unclear what Mrs. Renzi was doing in this ill-reputed part of town, which has recently been the scene of brawls involving young people known to the authorities. Police are still looking for the man who brought her to hospital and disappeared. Mr. Renzi is well respected for his dedication to the community and as a nominee for the Conservative Party. While his candidacy was not successful, he is believed to have proven his mettle.

Mrs. Renzi’s state is still one of great concern.

What will become of Fajza and who is responsible? Read more of this page-turning story of resilience and loss.
